heading: hang time
subheading: meatspace the can bar, despite its lowbrow moniker, comes off decidedly more futurama than hank hill. located near clerkenwell, london’s up-and-coming media hub, the minimalist space attracts creatives from bbc online and razorfish – not to mention suits from merrill lynch – looking to pay homage to the universal aluminum beer vessel. the main attraction?a […]
author: patricia krueger
text: meatspacethe can bar, despite its lowbrow moniker, comes off decidedly more futurama than hank hill. located near clerkenwell, london's up-and-coming media hub, the minimalist space attracts creatives from bbc online and razorfish - not to mention suits from merrill lynch - looking to pay homage to the universal aluminum beer vessel. the main attraction?a set of four willy wonka-style pneumatic tubes that whiz empty cans away for recycling. if you like your watering holes with plenty of kinetic entertainment, the can is for you.can: 50-52 long lane, london ec1; +44 (171) 796 0069.must readget verticalcalling all cars!infighting out in the openjargon watchreal's deal... meanwhilethe crazy things geniuses buyultima offlinehang timepeopleautonomous agenttired/wiredhigh-speed habitsbeing ruralcpr for your iporaw data
